title: Cristiano Ronaldo sculptor claims Real Madrid ace actually likes THAT statue
text:
'EVEN JESUS DIDN'T PLEASE EVERYONE' Cristiano Ronaldo sculptor claims Real Madrid ace actually likes THAT statue 
Former airport cleaner Emanuel Santos insists Ronaldo gave his work the thumbs up - even if the rest of the world hasn't By Gerard Couzens 30th March 2017, 9:04 am Updated: 30th March 2017, 10:13 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments 
THE sculptor behind the bizarre statue of Cristiano Ronaldo that has been mocked all over the world has defended his work and insisted the Real Madrid striker has told him he likes it. 
Emanuel Santos was unmasked as the artist whose hands crafted the bronze bust of the former Manchester United star to mark the renaming of an airport in his native Madeira after him. Reuters 11 Sculptor Emanuel Santos claims Cristiano Ronaldo likes his work 
The 40-year-old, who like Ronaldo comes from the Atlantic island, admitted he only took 15 days to complete the statue after proposing the idea to airport bosses when he found about the renaming pla ns. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news , gossip and rumours 
And he confessed he had to work off photos of the footballer because it would have been impossible to get “very busy” Ronaldo to model for him in person. 
Speaking to Brazilian outlet Globo, he said: “It is impossible to please the Greeks and Trojans. Even Jesus did not please everyone. This is a matter of taste, it’s not as simple as it seems. I have seen works by great artists that follow this parameter. 
“What matters is the impact that this work generates. There is always the possibility of making a difference, I was prepared for all this. 
“I used photos of Cristiano Ronaldo that I searched on the internet as a base. I put the photos next to me and started working on the bust.” 
But the former airport cleaner, who confesses to being self-taught and devoting himself full-time to sculpture for only the past two years, said he was happy with the result and said it had been given the thumbs-up by Cristiano and his doting mum Dolores as well as the airport chiefs who commissioned him. Santos…ridiculed for his work Reuters 11 Some say the Ronaldo statue reminds them of Bowser from the Super Mario Brothers film 
Insisting Dolores and Cristiano’s brother Hugo said the statute could go ahead after being shown the work before it was unveiled, he told Portuguese media: “Cristiano saw the photos that his brother sent him. 
“I was with the brother at Cristiano’s museum in Madeira and from the messages he sent, I could tell that he liked what he saw. “He only asked for some wrinkles that give him a certain expression in his face when he’s about to laugh to be changed. 
“He said it made him look older and asked for it to be thinned out a bit to make it smoother and more jovial. 
“But they gave it the go-ahead before they liked what they saw.” EPA Ronaldo’s girlfriend Georgina Rodriguez and six-year-old son Cristiano Jr. were at the unveiling Reuters 11 It was all smiles at the ceremony 
He added: “When I arrived at the airport the bust had already been unveiled for the start of the ceremony. 
“Cristiano was one of the last people to arrive but I spoke with him in the VIP room. I asked him what he thought of the result and he said he liked it.” 
The statute was trolled on Wednesday after it was unveiled at the Aeroporto Cristiano Ronaldo. 
The footballer, flanked by Dolores, Spanish girlfriend Georgina Rodriguez, and six-year-old son Cristiano Jr , said afterwards he was ‘happy and honoured’ at the honour. 
But instead of the rebranding taking centre stage, it was the bust that made all the headlines with some fans claiming the sculptor had drunk too much Madeiran wine before starting his work of art and others joking it made Cristiano look like something out of a horror film. 
The controversy is set to make Emanuel, who still lives in the small fishing village of Canical in the eastern part of Madeira and whose hobby before he focused on sculpture was making naval models, a big name outside the island.
